name: Tambapanni
description: Earliest recorded settlement under Vijaya, also known as Thammanna Nuwara.

name: Anuradhapura
description: First major kingdom; irrigation & Buddhist center

name: Anuradhapura (Chola Rule)
description: A period of South Indian Chola rule. The capital was moved to Polonnaruwa during this time.

name: Ruhuna
description: Founded around 200 BC by Prince Mahanaga after a dispute with his brother, King Devanampiya Tissa of Anuradhapura. Located in the south of Sri Lanka, it became a crucial center for Sinhalese culture and a base of resistance against invaders. Key cities included Magama and Tissamaharama.

name: Kelaniya Kingdom
description: A provincial kingdom with deep mythological and Buddhist significance. It was the capital of King Kelanitissa and the birthplace of Vihara Maha Devi.

name: Dedigama Kingdom
description: Birthplace of King Parakramabahu the Great and later the capital of King Parakramabahu V.

name: Raigama Kingdom
description: Emerged after the 'Vijayabā Kollaya' in 1521 and was later annexed by the Sitawaka Kingdom.
